revised_title: Discovery of Bacilli in the Breath of Persons Affected with Phthisis
tldr: The authors investigate the presence of bacilli in the condensed aqueous vapor of the breath of individuals affected with phthisis (tuberculosis) and find a specific bacillus that is indistinguishable from the bacillus found in tubercle. This discovery suggests that particles capable of transmitting the disease may be constantly breathed in by susceptible individuals.
